title: User-First Documentation - Write for the Dumbest User
summary: Documentation should be written for users with zero technical knowledge. Devs assume too much. The 99% don't know what PATH is. Write for your nan.

patterns: how do I know it worked section
what_devs_get_wrong: assuming users know what terminal is
assuming users know what PATH means
just pip install is not user friendly
clone the repo is not step 1 for normies

examples.bad: Clone the repo and run cargo build --release
examples.good:
1. Download the installer
2. Double-click to run
3. Click Install
4. Done

wisdom: This is what devs get WRONG - they assume or in their arrogance don't think of the 99% of users
If your nan can't follow the docs, rewrite them
Double click and run - that's the bar
Making things hard doesn't mean you're better, it's actually the opposite

author: BMETALC
